courses.name: Current Issues in Environment and Health

cmCourseInfo.description: This course introduces students to complex issues at the interface between environment and health where health is broadly defined. Each year a current and controversial case study is explored from scientific, medical, political and policy perspectives. The course takes students from the molecular to individual to population and societal levels.
cmCourseInfo.title: Current Issues in Environment and Health
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: 14 FCE complete, ENV341H1/ HMB302H1/HMB312H1/ HMB314H1/ HMB322H1

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

This course will be part of HMB pre-enrolment. Eligible program students will receive via email a ballot to rank eligible 400-level courses in order of preference between May 15 and June 21, 2020 with decisions confirmed June 30, 2020. Students who are not pre-enrolled in the course but meet the enrolment controls will be able to waitlist for the course once course enrolment starts.

Delivery Instructions

Lectures are live-streamed and recorded (permitting synchronous delivery, but also asynchronous attendance).  Students are strongly encouraged to participate synchronously (live stream) as numerous activities are planned (though none for grades). Students need access to Quercus and Blackboard Collaborate.
